description: Borrowed from New Latin capsicum, from Ancient Greek καψικός (kapsikós, “like a box”), from Latin capsa (“box”).

entries.meaning: Any of several tropical American plants, of the genus Capsicum, principally the species Capsicum annuum and Capsicum frutescens, that are cultivated as edible peppers.
(Australia, New Zealand, India, Singapore) The spicy fruit of the above plants, the bell pepper.
